content:
I note that the "Troubleshooting Information" page was not helpful; the zombie account username did not appear there.

The "Config Editor" was more help; clicking "Show All", then ticking "Show only modified preferences" whittled down the number of entries, then Ctrl-f allowed me to search for occurrences of the zombie. I found it in 2 places:

1) As a calendar account, though this account was NOT shown in the list of calendars on the left side of the "Calendars" tab. I think I did a decent job of deleting the various entries relating to the zombie, including the metaentries consisting of GUIDs and such of entries.

2) As an SMTP server, though this account was NOT shown in the list of SMTP servers in the "Account Settings" tab. Again, more tedious deletion of entries and searching for and deleting metadata in metaentries.

The fact that a deleted account was still being used, as evidenced by the regular popup of the OAuth prompt, yet was NOT shown in the main interfaces which purport to shows accounts, is ... an unexpected feature. Not a highly-rated one.

The zombie account is overdue for popping up another OAuth prompt, so there is hope that grunging about in "Config Editor", plus the holy water I sprinkled in the offering slot at the top of my server case, seems to have finally laid it to rest.
creator: retardude

content: Prihláste sa priamo z webu, či vám v gmail nenapísali, že vám zamietli možnost prihlásenia sa, a že prípadný útočník pozná vaše heslo, a že môžete znížiť zabezpečenie a potom že to pôjde. Takže problém môže byť aj vo vyššom zabezpečení na strane google.com. Stáva sa to vtedy, pokiaľ sa použije v krátkom čase pri prístupe k vášmu účtu viac prehliadačov alebo viac IP adries k prihláseniu. „Nedávno jsme zabránili pokusu o přihlášení do tohoto zařízení. Uvedli jste, že jste tento pokus provedli vy. Pro účely zabezpečení se toto zařízení bude po dobu dvou týdnů zobrazovat v seznamu. Zmíněnou událost můžete také prověřit na stránce“ = Preverte či mate vypnuté dvojstupňové overenie: https://myaccount.google.com/security?pli=1#signin a zapnite aj prístup pre menej bezpečné aplikácie: https://www.google.com/settings/security/lesssecureapps = A ešte preverte na webe, či ste si vo svojom účte povolili POP, alebo IMAP prístup: http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/01/12/Gmail_POP3_povoleny.jpg http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/01/12/gmail_IMPAP.jpg = 1. Odstránte z Thunderbirdu ten problémový účet na gmail.com 2. Ukončite a znova spustite Thunderbird 3. Vytvorte NOVÝ (ten odstránený ) účet 4. Nechajte Thunderbird, aby automaticky vytvoril tento účet na gmail.com. Nijak neupravujte automaticky nastavený POP alebo SMTP prístup k účtu. Iba zadajte správne prístupové MENO a prístupové HESLO. 5. Potom by to malo fungovať.

creator: john391

content:
To share a bit more: threading has been the default since summer of 2022. This is the official (to my knowledge) documentation. Well worth the read https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird

Cutting to the quick fix: 

More info:  To change default for *new* folders, In config editor, you can change default that applies to NEW folders you set up: mailnews.default_view_flags      0 =unthreaded    Config editor is available at Tools>settings>general and scroll to bottom right.   Here is another way to change the threaded option:  - create a simple text file with name of user.js with these lines:       // Set default threading to UNthreaded  ###   <== this line is optional, just for documentation      user_pref("mailnews.default_view_flags", 0); - install Thunderbird and exit prior to setting up accounts	  - copy the user.js file into the profile - now, when you start Thunderbird, unthreading will be the default. Problem solved.
creator: davidsk

creator: donlf

content:
Close TB, open the profile folder pv4x..., copy the mbox file into the Mail/Local Folders subfolder, remove the .mbox extension if it's present, restart TB, find the folder under Local Folders in the Folder Pane.

You can always open the profile folder from Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Show in Finder. Also, from Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles.

content:
Da quel che scrivi sembrerebbe che tu abbia semplicemente usato il protocollo IMAP per sincronizzare la posta anche sulla nuova installazione.

Se vuoi trasferire tutte le impostazioni di Thunderbird la procedura da seguire è descritta qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/trasferire-dati-thunderbird-nuovo-computer

Se invece vuoi trasferire solo la rubrica, ti basta esportarla in un file CSV dal vecchio computer ed importare questo file nel nuovo.

Infine se vuoi trasferire solo le mail delle cartelle locali puoi usare uno dei metodi descritti qui -> https://codeberg.org/m13o/TBook/wiki/Thunderbird+-+Importare+mbox.-
creator: @next

content:
Mozilla does not have the resources to have call centres to do one on one support for their main products like the Firefox web browser for desktop and mobile.

Thunderbird is operated by the Mozilla Foundation's subsidiary MZLA Technologies Corporation. Thunderbird is an independent, community-driven project that is managed and overseen by the Thunderbird Council.

It is generally the paid for apps or subscription based apps that may get more direct or one on one support by phone, chat, email or ticket because they well paid for it. Mozilla does have some subscription based products (like Mozilla VPN) that gets direct ticket support here.

Short answer is No, there is no one on one support by phone, chat, email or ticket for the open source free to download and user Thunderbird email client.

Also you should not post your phone#, full email or such on this public community support forum as search engines and other bots may find it.

creator: dunc1984

content:
Are you confusing webmail services like gmail.com with Thunderbird, a local client? They are quite different in their security risks.

Loading images by default is very, very dangerous. It could be a virus vector, as there have been security failures in image rendering routines and that has allowed viruses to be installed just be looking at a specially crafted image. More commonly, the images in mail, including spam, are fetched using URLs that tell them that you, specifically you, are reading it, so the know that your email address is good (resellable to other spammers as validated). In any case it's bad for your privacy. So you really should not want to load images without first deciding it's mail you deem safe.

What a web mail program can do is load the image itself and try to figure out if it has tracking included and just display a cleaned-up image at you. But a client can't do that by itself as it's already on your home system.

content: The reply was useful but the general layout is poor in comparison with how it was a few weeks ago. Shows only a few messages in the inbox and the folders pane is extremely narrow. Can I revert to the earlier version?
creator: ornees31

content:
The folder pane can be made wider by clicking and dragging the separator between the pane and the message list. Check that you don't have any filters applied in the Quick Filter Bar and View/Threads is All.

If you try to revert to an earlier version, your current profile will be incompatible, but if you create a new profile, you'll have to add the accounts. Not recommended unless you're familiar with profile management.
creator: sfhowes

content: Thank you for your advice - very helpful. But I would like to revert to the earlier version. How would I do this, and create a new profiler?
creator: ornees31

content:
The installer for the previous version can be downloaded here:

https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/115.14.0/win64/

If, on first run, it doesn't start with a new profile, one can be created from Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles. In fact, if you decide to stay with TB 128 but wish to create a new profile, the method is the same.
